greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(m,n) = Sum_{ 1 <= i <= m, 1 <= j <= n, gcd(i,j)=1 } i*j, for 1 <= n <= m.
comment: The last two diagonals are A333293, Sum_{k=1..n-1} k^2*phi(k) + n^2*phi(n)/2, and A319087, Sum_{k=1..n} k^2*phi(k), where phi = A000010. Is there a similar formula for the general term?
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
maple: seq(seq(T(m, n), n=1..m), m=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 23 2020
xref: First two columns are A000217 and A074378, rightmost two diagonals are A333293 and A319087.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 23 2020
